title: 'Only smart citizens can turn Faridabad into a smart city'
content:
The article below represents a preview only and is not meant for reuse or republishing. 
Faridabad, Sept. 19 -- I have been a resident of Sector 19 for more than 25 years, being born and brought up in the family of a farmer in village Palla, Faridabad. I did my engineering from YMCA University. I worked as a mechanical engineer in India and abroad. I returned from the United States in October 1993 and started Jiva Institute with a goal to establish a healthy, prosperous and peaceful society. 
Today, when I look back, the aroma of henna fills my mind. Before and after Independence, Faridabad was known for coloured hands with beautiful designs. Henna was the only source of economy in the city and Old Faridabad the only township. Year 1950 saw prog-ress after the thrust by Jawaharlal Nehru and then companies like Escorts, Good Yea...
